perturbation.original_text:
This Turn - Key Manufacturing Agreement (the “Agreement”) is effective as of the 1.4.2011 (the “Effective Date”) by and between:
INVASIX LTD., with a principal place of business at Tavor Building, Shaar Yokneam, POB 533, Yokneam 20692, Israel. Hereinafter referred to as
“Customer”
And
FLEXTRONICS ISRAEL LTD. with a principal place of business at Industrial Zone Migdal Haemek 23108 P.O.B. 867, Israel. Hereinafter referred to
as “Contractor.”
perturbation.changed_text:
This Turn - Key Manufacturing Agreement (the “Agreement”) is effective as of the 1.4.2011 (the “Effective Date”) by and between:
INVASIX LTD., with a principal place of business at Tavor Building, Shaar Yokneam, POB 533, Yokneam 20692, Israel. Hereinafter referred to as
“Client”
And
FLEXTRONICS ISRAEL LTD. with a principal place of business at Industrial Zone Migdal Haemek 23108 P.O.B. 867, Israel. Hereinafter referred to
as “Service Provider.”
perturbation.explanation: The terms “Customer” and “Contractor” are key defined roles. By changing them to “Client” and “Service Provider” respectively, the contract becomes ambiguous. Later references to “Customer” and “Contractor” will be unclear.

perturbation.original_text:
Contractor shall permit Customer to audit its quality procedures, upon three (3) business day advance written notice to Contractor and shall
provide all assistance which is reasonably necessary for Customer to evaluate the quality of the Products.
9.2
Contractor shall maintain quality assurance standards in accordance with ISO 13488, Seller’s Quality Assurance, Control and Inspection shall
be in compliance with all material ISO 13488 standards during the Terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Service Provider shall permit Customer to audit its quality procedures, upon three (3) business day advance written notice to Service Provider and shall
provide all assistance which is reasonably necessary for Client to evaluate the quality of the Products.
9.2
Contractor shall maintain quality assurance standards in accordance with ISO 13488, Vendor’s Quality Assurance, Control and Inspection shall
be in compliance with all material ISO 13488 standards during the Terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces several conflicting terms. In the first sentence, "Contractor" is replaced with "Service Provider," but "Customer" is replaced with "Client," referencing the earlier change. In the second sentence, the introduction of “Vendor” creates confusion as to which entity is responsible for quality assurance, as Vendor is undefined and used interchangeably with contractor.

perturbation.original_text:
Customer will not pass through to end users or other third parties the warranties made by Contractor under this Agreement. Furthermore,
Customer will not make any representations to end users or other third parties on behalf of Contractor, and Customer will expressly indicate
that the end users and third parties must look solely to Customer in connection with any problems, warranty claim or other matters
concerning the Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
Client will not pass through to end users or other third parties the warranties made by Supplier under this Agreement. Furthermore,
Customer will not make any representations to end users or other third parties on behalf of Service Provider, and Customer will expressly indicate
that the end users and third parties must look solely to Customer in connection with any problems, warranty claim or other matters
concerning the Product.
perturbation.explanation: This section modifies the terms 'Customer' and 'Contractor' from the original text, changing them to 'Client', 'Supplier', and 'Service Provider'. The inconsistent use of these different terms for the same entities creates ambiguity and potential disputes over warranty responsibilities.
